summary: This is an email chain between attorneys discussing Jeffrey Epstein's bail application. The email forwards commentary criticizing the legal arguments made by Epstein's defense attorney, Reid Weingarten, particularly regarding equal protection and socioeconomic status in the context of private security and confinement.

events.title: Email discussion of Epstein's bail application
events.description: Attorneys exchange emails critiquing the legal arguments in Reid Weingarten's bail letter for Jeffrey Epstein, including the offer to deregister his private jet and arguments about equal protection.

keyFacts: Reid Weingarten, as Epstein's attorney, filed a bail application arguing that refusing to allow a rich defendant to hire private guards and live in his mansion implicates equal protection concerns, discriminating based on socioeconomic status.
The bail application included an offer to 'deregister or otherwise ground his private jet' as a condition.
The email sender expresses a negative opinion of Epstein's chances for bail, stating 'Epstein's chances not good.'
The correspondence is between legal professionals at the firm Kobre & Kim LLP, indicating legal community discussion of the case.
